page.title: 06Religion
page.content: The vicar of the parish which includes {St Denys' church}has been curate for 27 years. He had previously spent 16 years teaching at{Bradfield College,}a local public school. Before actually training to be a priest he was in the army and volunteered for service at the outbreak of the second world war, during which time he achieved the rank of{Captain.}The church at Stanford Dingley, which is ministered by the {Bishop of Reading,}has two services a week. On sundays they are at 8.00 a.m and 11.00 a.m. The congregation numbers from between 25 to 35. The organ is played by a local parishioner. While the priest has seen little change in Stanford Dingley he has noticed a marked change in 60 years in the reduction of local shops and buses ( which used to run every hour from 6.00 a.m to 11.00 a.m.
